title: Variables
text:
The variables that are used in this project are:
win_rate- How often a player wins their games.
elim_rate- How many kills and damage assists a player gets on average in 10 minutes.
death_rate- How many deaths a player gets on average in 10 minutes.
KDA- Average of all kills and assists divided by deaths for all mathches played by a player.
dmg_rate- How much damage a player gets on average in 10 minutes.
heal_rate- How much healing a player gives on average in 10 minutes.

title: Model
text:
The formula used for the model is:
win_rate = beta_0 + elim_rate(beta_1) + death_rate(beta_2) + KDA(beta_3) + dmg_rate(beta_4) + heal_rate(beta_5)

title: OW2 Season 4 Win Rate Predictions
text: The objective of this project is to identify win rates of OW2 characters based on statistics in the game. The data used for this project came from Kaggle, submitted by a data analyst working for Team 4 at Activision Blizzard (OW2 Team). The data, submitted after the conclusion of Season 4, is the most accurate available without directly working for Team 4. The model used for this project is a causal model, modeling the variable win_rate as a function of many different statistical factors present in OW2. Using metrics such as K/D/A ratio, eliminations per 10 minutes, damage per 10 minutes, healing per 10 minutes, and deaths per 10 minutes, we will try to predict win rates based on these factors. Based on the collected data, the win rates of players tend to be the highest when their statistics for each variable is at the 60-80 percentile of that variables spectrum.

title: Sources
text: The data used for this project came from Kaggle. The user that input this data is a data analyst that works for team 4 at Activision Blizzard (OW2 Team). They had submitted this data after the conclusion of season 4 making the data the most accurate data that can be found wiithout working direcctly for team 4.
